 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָדַח‎</span>] **verb** ==impel, thrust, banish== (especially Deuteronomy, Jeremiah and later) (Late Hebrew ***id., beguile***, Hiph, Niph\`al; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְדַח‎</span> (rare) = Biblical Hebrew; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; ***thrust***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***drive*** a ship to*** shore***); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִדַּח‎</span> [[2Sam.14.14|2Sam 14:14]] Infinitive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִנְדֹּחַ‎</span> [[Deut.20.19|Deut 20:19]] — transitive 

**1.** ***impel*** (i.e. ***wield***) an axe, followed by<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלֿ‎</span> [[Deut.20.19|Deut 20:19]] 

**2.** ***thrust away, banish*** followed by<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִןֿ‎</span> [[2Sam.14.14|2Sam 14:14]]. **Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִדְּחָה‎</span> [[Job.6.13|Job 6:13]], etc.; (***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִדַּ֫חוּ‎</span> [[Jer.23.12|Jer 23:12]] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דחח‎</span>); ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִדָּח‎</span> [[2Sam.14.14|2Sam 14:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִדָּחָה‎</span> [[Mic.4.6|Mic 4:6]] + 2 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִדַּ֫חַת‎</span> [[Ezek.34.4|Ezek 34:4]]; [[Ezek.34.16|Ezek 34:16]], etc. On <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִדְחֵי‎</span> [[Isa.11.12|Isa 11:12]]; [[Isa.56.8|Isa 56:8]]; [[Ps.147.2|Ps 147:2]] see [[BDB#Ki|Ki]] [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>i. 317</sup>; — 

**1.** ***be impelled:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנִדְּחָה יָרוֺ בַּגַּרְוֶן‎</span> ***be impelled*** with the axe [[Deut.19.5|Deut 19:5]]. 

**2.** ***be thrust out, banished:*** of dispersion in exile, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁם‎</span> [[Jer.40.12|Jer 40:12]]; [[Jer.43.5|Jer 43:5]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּב‎</span>); followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנֵי‎</span> [[Jer.49.5|Jer 49:5]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קִבֵּץ‎</span>); compare also figurative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תֻּשִׁיָּה נִדְּחָה מִמֶּנִּי‎</span> [[Job.6.13|Job 6:13]] ***is banished from me***, i.e. is non-existent; especially Participle ***banished one(s), outcast(s)***, as accusative of congnate meaning with verb with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָדַח‎</span>[[2Sam.14.14|2Sam 14:14]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קִבֵּץ‎</span> [[Mic.4.6|Mic 4:6]]; [[Deut.30.4|Deut 30:4]]; [[Zeph.3.19|Zeph 3:19]]; [[Neh.1.9|Neh 1:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשִׂרָאֵל‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span>, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָסַף‎</span> [[Isa.11.12|Isa 11:12]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְפֻצוֺת יְקַבֵּץ‎</span>); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קִבֵּץ‎</span> [[Isa.56.8|Isa 56:8]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּנֵּס‎</span> [[Ps.147.2|Ps 147:2]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵשִׁיב‎</span> [[2Sam.14.13|2Sam 14:13]]; [[Ezek.34.4|Ezek 34:4]]; [[Ezek.34.16|Ezek 34:16]] (both \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֹבֵד‎</span>); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בּוֺא‎</span> [[Isa.27.13|Isa 27:13]] (\|\| ***id.***); see also [[Isa.16.3|Isa 16:3]]; [[Isa.16.4|Isa 16:4]]; [[Jer.49.36|Jer 49:36]] ***outcast = neglected one***, figurative of Zion [[Jer.30.17|Jer 30:17]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֹּרֵשׁ אֵין לָהּ‎</span>). 

**3.** ***driven away*** (from herd, i.e.) ***straying*** [[Deut.22.1|Deut 22:1]]. 

**4.** ***thrust away, aside from*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> ***to idiolatry*** [[Deut.4.19|Deut 4:19]]; [[Deut.30.17|Deut 30:17]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה‎</span>).

**Pu\`al** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲקֵלָה מְנֻדָּח‎</span> [[Isa.8.22|Isa 8:22]] ***thrust into darkness***.

**Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִדִּיחַ‎</span> consecutive [[2Sam.15.14|2Sam 15:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִדַּ֫חְתִּי‎</span> [[Jer.23.3|Jer 23:3]]; [[Jer.29.14|Jer 29:14]], etc.; ***Imperfect*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדַּח‎</span> [[2Chr.21.11|2Chr 21:11]] + [[2Kgs.17.21|2Kgs 17:21]] [[BDB#Qr|Qr]]; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדִּ֫יחוּ‎</span> [[Deut.13.14|Deut 13:14]], etc.; ***Imperative*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַדִּיחֵ֫מוֺ‎</span> [[Ps.5.11|Ps 5:11]] ***Infinitive*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַדִּיחַ‎</span> [[Ps.62.5|Ps 62:5]], etc.; — 

**1.** ***thrust, move, impel***, figurative, object <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָעָה‎</span> [[2Sam.15.14|2Sam 15:14]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלֿ‎</span>. 

**2.** ***thrust out, banish, especially*** of exile, subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, with accusative followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁ֫מָּה‎</span> [[Deut.30.1|Deut 30:1]]; [[Jer.46.28|Jer 46:28]]; [[Jer.16.15|Jer 16:15]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶעֱלָה‎</span>); followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁם‎</span> [[Jer.8.3|Jer 8:3]]; [[Jer.24.9|Jer 24:9]]; [[Jer.29.18|Jer 29:18]]; [[Dan.9.7|Dan 9:7]] + [[Ezek.4.13|Ezek 4:13]] (omitted by [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Co|Co]]); [[Jer.23.3|Jer 23:3]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קִבֵּץ‎</span>), v[[Jer.23.8|Jer 23:8]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶעֱלָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵבִיא‎</span>) [[Jer.29.14|Jer 29:14]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קִבֵּץ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵשֹׁיב‎</span>), so [[Jer.32.37|Jer 32:37]] also [[Jer.27.10|Jer 27:10]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרְחִיק‎</span>), v[[Jer.27.15|Jer 27:15]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָבַד‎</span>), compare [[Jer.23.2|Jer 23:2]] (Judah under figure of flock, subject evil shepherd, \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵפִיץ‎</span>), [[Jer.50.17|Jer 50:17]] (Israel as sheep, subject enemies as lions); of driving out priests [[2Chr.13.9|2Chr 13:9]] invader [[Joel.2.20|Joel 2:20]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span>); wicked [[Ps.5.11|Ps 5:11]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַאֲשִׁימֵם‎</span>); good man from his eminence [[Ps.62.5|Ps 62:5]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>). 

**3.** ***thrust away, aside***, from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> to idolatry, with accusative, [[Deut.13.14|Deut 13:14]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִןהַֿדֶּרֶךְ‎</span> v.[[Deut.13.6|Deut 13:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵעַל י‎</span> v.[[Deut.13.11|Deut 13:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵאַחֲרֵי י‎</span> [[2Kgs.17.21|2Kgs 17:21]] [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] ([[BDB#Kt|Kt]] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נדא‎</span>); compare [[2Chr.21.11|2Chr 21:11]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִזְנָה‎</span>). 

**4.** ***compel, force***, subject adulteress (by flattery), followed by accusative [[Prov.7.21|Prov 7:21]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִטָּה‎</span>).

**Hoph\`al** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֻדָּח‎</span> ***chased, hunted***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צְבִי מ‎</span> [[Isa.13.14|Isa 13:14]], simile of fugitive Babylonians.
